exercises.title: ArrayList with Integer
problem: Let us have an array of integer tab = [17, 18, 19, 17, 20, 22, 24].
1. Creates an arrayList of students ages std_ages from tab
2. Add two new elements 21, 20 using add().
3. Display the elements at 3 and 10 positions using get(). What do you notice?
4. Update the element at the 3rd position to 20 using set().
5. Insert 23 at the 2nd position using add()
6. Create a copy named std_ages_copy of the list using clone ()
7. Delete the element at the 4th position using remove().
8. Delete 17, get and display the list size.
9. Create another arraylist of kids ages: kids_ages = [5, 4, 7, 4, 8]
10. Put together both lists into a new one named people using addAll(Collection <> c).
11. Get from people the sub list between 3'd and 8th positions.
exercises.explanation: This exercise teaches the core operations of ArrayList: adding, removing, updating, cloning and extracting sublists. Unlike regular arrays, ArrayList is dynamic and it grows and shrinks automatically, which makes it more flexible for managing collections of data.
